1. Over medium heat, heat oil
2. Add onions and stir to evenly incorporate in the oil

Method: 1.Preheat oven to 400*F 2.In large mixing bowl, combine tomatillos, poblanos, jalapenos, oil and S+P. Mix well to coat. 3.Place cooling rack over med high flame on burners. Roast tomatillos, peppers and onions until charred all over. Place on baking tray. Add garlic. 4.Roast until peppers, onions and tomatillos are cooked through and soft enough to blitz in food processor, about 10-15 minutes. 5.In bowl of food processor, add roasted vegetables, cilantro leaves and stems, lime juice and salt. Process until smooth in consistency.

Method: 1.Drain Cannelini Beans. The Yield on these beans has been calculated in this recipe - roughly the loss of over a Kilogram in "Aqua Fava". A quick rinse is valued, but not entirely necessary. 2.Half all Grape Tomatoes. You will notice in this recipe that 5 LBS is the measured amount require. This is because each box of Grape Tomatoes that comes in from Freshpoint is 10 LBS - meaning: use half of a box for this recipe. Easy enough? 3.Small Dice yellow Onions. Saute with Cumin and Cayenne, adding 1 Bag of Frozen Corn and Red Pepper to the mix along the way. Do not roast this Corn in the oven for any reason - its starches develop and it becomes tough texturally. Deglaze this mixture with Apple Cider Vinegar, and season.
- Pick Oregano. Don't bother picking the Cilantro, as some stem is fine in this recipe. Rough Chop both of these, and reserve to add into the rest of this recipe.
- Label / Date / Store Appropriately...
NOTE: This recipe will last if properly refrigerated for up to 5 days. This is a large batch for this item, since it's new to the menu and may not sell well depending on diner preferences. Do not make more than this until it's proven that it will move. Waste not want not!
